meanings.sent1: The band hoped to outrock all others at the concert.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outrock her competition with her powerful vocals.
meanings.sent3: The guitarist tried to outrock the drummer, but ended up playing a wrong note.
meanings.sent4: Their energetic performance seemed to outrock the very essence of rock itself.
meanings.sent5: With each chord, the guitarist aimed to outrock the legends of the past.

meanings.sent1: The new band aimed to outrock the established groups in town.
meanings.sent2: He practiced tirelessly to outrock his own previous performances.
meanings.sent3: The singer tried to outrock the guitarist by hitting higher notes.
meanings.sent4: Their music seemed to outrock the expectations of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The drummer's solo managed to outrock every other part of the song.

meanings.sent1: The young musician dreamed of one day outrocking the rock legends.
meanings.sent2: The band's latest album aimed to outrock their previous records.
meanings.sent3: Despite the technical difficulties, they managed to outrock the other bands.
meanings.sent4: Their passion for music allowed them to outrock any obstacles in their way.
meanings.sent5: The lead singer's voice had the power to outrock any other instrument on stage.
